message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NA 

The paper deals with optimization modeling for the index coding problem, which is a fundamental problem in information theory. The paper proposes a novel sparse and low-rank optimization framework for the index coding problem, which involves optimization techniques and machine learning concepts. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also involves optimization techniques, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category. The paper also involves concepts of sparsity and low-rankness, which makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes a novel Riemannian optimization framework, which makes cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) a likely sub-category.
